nodes.bodyText: in a future change we can actually return a constant injector, as the formats won't change per call to inject. The advantage would be similar to other places where we have constant vs composite... even though the iteration across an array of size two is fast, it shouldn't be quicker than something with no array. By default, there's only one inject format per kind.

oh... I have an idea that's much easier! Add a subtype in request!
Request.Setter extends Propagation.Setter
exposes spanKind()
With this, we can hardwire B3 without needing reflection at runtime except the slow path for things that haven't extended Request.Setter yet.

I'm tempted to do generic foo in <R> TraceContext.Injector<R> injector(Setter<R, K> setter); to find out the bound of R.. (reflection look up the TypeVariable of the setter) if we could, and found it was a request, then we wouldn't have to do this runtime check!
not tempted now. just a nag for future.

This is an internal type exctracted from B3. I don't plan to do a huge amount of polishing on this in this PR as I'm at a severe time deficit. I will puts with it post merge though and any significant changes needed pre-merge
